text:
Appointment:
For every new employee, they will receive an appointment letter from the HR department before starting their duties.

Employee Personal Information:
Employees should provide updated personal information for record purposes.

Pre-employment medical check-up:
All new employees must undergo a medical check-up before the letter of employment is issued.

Orientation Program:
onducted by the HR Department for all new employees to help them understand the Group's policies and benefit

Departmental Orientation:
Conducted by the Head of SBU for the new Employee

Probation and Confirmation:
- All permanent employees are required to serve a 6-month probation period from the date of appointment.
- Probationary period may be extended for up to another 6months if the performance does not meet the Group's standards
- The Group can terminate an employee if they do not fulfull expectations during or end of probation period.

Travelling Claims:
Reimbursement of Travelling Claims and Petrol Allowance:

Petrol allowance:
The mileage claim rate for motorcars is 
RM0.90 (inclusive of toll and parking expenses).

Mobile Phone Allowance:
The company provides mobile phone allowance: The Group provides a mobile phone allowance for confirmed professional employees only.
Employees can claim up to a maximum of RM50.00 per month.
Entertainment Claims: For entertainment claims, only employees of job grade M1 and above are entitled to entertainment claims for Group business purposes.

Long Service Awards:
Rewarded for committed and loyal employees.
Periods of No Pay Leave shall not be counted towards the continuous
service period.

Recreational Membership Benefit: 
Core Team members are eligible for one of three types of memberships: Golf Club, Non-Golf Club, or Gym/Beauty.

Company trip subsidy: 
The Group encourages employees to attend company trips to build teamwork and bonding. 
Confirmed employees will be provided with assistance in the form of a financial subsidy or an interest-free loan for the trip, based on their job grade.

Examination Fees:
The Group supports the continuous development of employees and encourages them to pursue professional qualifications under the Group's employment.

Education Assistance Programme:
A confirmed employee who has completed at least two (2) years of
continuous service with the Group shall be eligible to apply for the EAP.
The limit of the EAP subsidy per employee per programme
shall be as follows: 
- Core Team: 40,000
- Non-core Team: 30,000

A maximum of two (2) EAP subsidy awards shall be awarded per calendar year.

Commitment Incentive:
A confirmed employees who does not utilise any of his medical leave and/or emergency leave entitlement within the relevant assessment
period shall be eligible for the following commitment incentive, provided
they have been punctual during the relevant assessment period:
- Medical Leave: RM300
- Emergency Leave: RM300
- Medical and Emergency Leave: RM1,000

The disbursement of the commitment incentive shall be paid within two
(2) months immediately after the end of each assessment period.

Vision: To be a highly reliable regional professional firm. , Committed to improving the quality of life of its employees
and provide a full range of high-quality, value-added services, delivered by the best and most practical people.

Mission:
- To be the best company to work for, where employees are treated as part of a big family
- To leverage technology and the UHY international brand to improve the gross margin
- To venture into financial services to enhance the Group's income stream.

Section: Leave

Federal and State Public Holidays:
Employees are entitled to paid holidays on all gazetted Federal and State Public Holidays in their state.
If a public holiday falls on a Sunday, the next working day is a replacement holiday.
Employees can leave one and a half hours early on the eve of Chinese New Year, Hari Raya Puasa, Hari Raya Haji, Wesak Day, Deepavali, and Christmas Day.

Annual leave:
For rest, relaxation, and personal matters. Entitlements are calculated on a calendar year basis.

Annual Leave Entitlements per Calendar Year:
M3 and E1 and above are: 
1. Less than 2 years of service: 18 days.
2. Between 2-5 years of service: 18 days.
3. More than 5 years of service: 24 days. 

For E2 and below: 
Less than 2 years of service: 14 days
Between 2-5 years of service: 16 days
More than 5 years of service: 18 days.

A confirmed employee who has not completed a full year of service by December 31st will receive a proportionate amount of annual leave.

An employee who fails to take such leave at the end of each calendar year shall be allowed to carry forward a maximum of five (5) days of
such annual leave to the following year. 

All leaves carried forward mustbe consumed within the first three (3) months of the year to which it is carried forward otherwise it shall be forfeited.

An employee shall apply for his annual leave one (1) week in advance.
Where the application for leave is more than five (5) working days, employees shall apply for approval two (2) weeks in advance

Medical and hospitalisation leave:
Employees are entitled to paid medical leave based on the Employment Act, 1955.
Medical leave is granted with a recommendation from a Registered Medical Practitioner and a supporting medical certificate.
Paid Medical leave:
- Less 2 years of service = 14 days
- 2-5 years of service = 18 days
- More than 5 years = 22 days

Maternity leave:
-Female employees are entitled to a maximum of 60 consecutive days of maternity leave.
-Leave can be taken before and/or immediately after the day of delivery.
-Leave on account of miscarriage prior to the 28th week of pregnancy
shall not be considered as maternity leave but as normal medical leave.
- A female employee shall be entitled to paid maternity leave if:
    - She has worked for a continuous period of ninety (90) days
    during the nine (9) months period before the day of the confinement and;
    - She is an employee at any time during the four (4) months before
    the confinement.
- The maternity leave may be taken on, before and/or immediately after
the day of delivery.
- The employee shall apply for maternity leave not less than four (4)
weeks prior commencement of the intended maternity leave period.
- During the maternity leave, the employee shall be paid in the normal
manner.


Marriage leave:
Confirmed employees with at least one year of continuous service are entitled to three working days of paid marriage leave for their first legal marriage.

Paternity leave:
Confirmed male employees with at least one year of continuous service are entitled to two working days of paternity leave for the birth of every child to their first legal wife, up to five deliveries.
The employee shall be required to produce documentary evidence (eg. birth certificate) in support of his application.

Compassionate leave: 
Employees are eligible for two working days of compassionate leave for the death of a family member.
The maximum number of compassionate leave days shall not exceed six (6) days per annum.

Examination and study leave:
Employees are eligible for 3 working days of exam/study leave per subject for their first attempt while pursuing Group-approved courses.

Section: Leaving the company

Termination procedure: 
An employee can be terminated by the Group or can terminate their service by giving written notice or payment in lieu of notice.

Upon termination, the employee must surrender all Group property and settle any liabilities.

An employee is eligible to receive all unused accrued leave for the calendar year if they have complied with all exit procedures.

Termination of Employment:

- Either party may terminate the contract with a written notice or payment in lieu.
- The termination notice period is based on the following:
    - During Probation: 1 month.
    - M3 and above: 2 weeks.
    - E1 and below: 3 months.
    - Upon Confirmation: 
        - M3 and above: 3 month notice period
        - E1: 2 month notice period
        - E2 and below: 1 month.

- The employee who has resigned from the Group shall not be eligible for re-hiring three (3) years from his resignation except with the approval from the Senior Partner/Group CEO.

Job abandonment:
Employee that abandons job will be terminated immediately, and not eligible for rehire.

Retirement:
When employee reaches the official age for retirement at 55 years old on their birthday

Exit Interview:
 When an employee leaves the company, they may be asked to attend an "exit interview" with the Head of SBU

Section: Medical Benefits

Outpatient and Specialist Medical and Dental Benefits:
Medical and specialist benefits are provided to confirmed employees only.

Medical Benefit:
RM500 per calendar/RM 50 per visit

Dental Benefit:
M1 and above: RM500 per calendar year.
M3 and below: RM200 per calendar year.

Dental Benefit Information: 
The coverage of dental treatment shall exclude dental treatment of cosmetic nature.

Prolonged Illness: An employee diagnosed with a prolonged illness during their employment is entitled to provisions for the subsequent six months as follows:
1st - 3rd month: Full pay leave.
4th - 6th month: No pay leave.

At the end of the six (6) months period, if the employee is still certified
unfit to work by a Registered Medical Practitioner, the Group shall
reserve the right to terminate the employment on medical grounds.

Group Insurance Coverage: 
The Group provides insurance coverage for confirmed employees.
An employee shall be required to obtain a referral letter from a general practitioner to be eligible for the hospitalisation and surgical benefit coverage.

Accident:
In the event of an accident, an employee or his next of kin shall
immediately inform the Head of SBU/Line Manager or the Admin
Department in the event of any accident, where possible.

Section: Overtime & Time-Off Lieu

For overtime employees with a salary of RM1,500.00 or less per month are entitled to claim overtime allowance.
The overtime rate is one and a half (1 1/2) times the hourly pay.

For the first hour, payment is calculated in units of 30 minutes, rounded to the nearest 30 minutes.

Time-Off-In-Lieu:
Applicable to employees earning RM1,501.00 and above.

General claim processes:
Employees can claim a meal allowance if they meet the overtime work conditions.
Overtime claims must be submitted by the 15th of each month to the Head of SBU/Line Manager for recommendation and then to the HR/Admin Department for verification before final approval from the Group CEO.

Section: Performance Management System

Performance Appraisal:
The Group has a performance appraisal system to ensure all employees perform at their best. 

The system recognizes good performance and provides suggestions for improvement.

All employees are given Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) with detailed requirements and expectations.

Performance is evaluated via a performance appraisal. Appraisals are conducted at least once a year by the Head of SBU/Line Manager.

Performance Interview:
- The purpose of performance evaluation meeting is to:
    - Provide the Head of SBU/Line Manager and the employee an opportunity to discuss job performance during the previous performance cycle.
    - Plan for future performance objectives.
    - Ensure the evaluation meeting is a careful planning and preparation part of the Head of SBU/Line Managers and employee.

Section: Rules and Regulations

Grounds for Disciplinary Action:
Examples of major misconducts:
- Disclosing any confidential information, including
confidential information of the Group‚Äôs clients to third parties
without proper authorisation
- Habitual absence without leave, or absence without leave for
more than three (3) consecutive working days.
- Misappropriation of Group funds.

Disciplinary Action:
The Head of SBU or immediate superior may impose any one or
combination of the following disciplinary action against an employee: -
1. Verbal warning;
2. Written warning;
3. Final written warning;
4. Formal action, which will include but is not limited to:-
    - suspension with or without pay for a period of time;
    - Reduction of salary
    - Dismissal with contractual notice; and
    - Filing a legal suit against employee.

Section: Salary

Payment of salary is done on monthly basis, payments are made through the bank designated by the group

For income tax, The Group will make income tax deductions according to the latest tax schedule. 
Employees are responsible for settling their own salary tax liabilities unless otherwise specified.

Employee Provident Fund (EPF): The Group contributes 12% of basic salary for all employees.
An additional 3% is contributed for employees who have completed more than five years of continuous service.
Social Security Contribution (SOCSO): The Group contributes to SOCSO as per the Employees' Social Security Organisation Act.

Annual increment and bonus payments are based on: 
- discretion of the group
- annual performance appraisal
- past performance improvement, dependability, attitude, cooperation, and disciplinary action taken
- adherence to all Employment Policies
- salary range of the employee's position.

For transfer And secondment, the Group can transfer or second an employee within any section, department, or division based on its operational needs.

Promotion happens where employees that are promoted must serve a 6-month probation period. 
  In the event where the employee is unable to perform and meet the higher responsibility and expectations satisfactorily and thus not confirmed in his new position, he shall be reverted to his former position and withdraw his acting allowance without prejudice to his future prospect within the Group

Normal working hours is Monday to Friday, 8:30 am to 5:30 pm 

Lunch break is from 1.00pm to 2.00pm
